Direct message the job poster from UP.Labs
Jonathan Meyrowitz
Vice President, Talent & People at UP.Labs
Job Description:As our Head of Data Science, you will be leading the data team, plan projects and build analytics models, leveraging on large volumes of data across a variety of sources. You will work in a cross-functional team with product owner, user experience designers, business analysts, engineers and data scientists to explore concepts, iterate on prototypes, and ultimately to make better product decisions. You are also responsible for supporting the growth and professional development of the team of data scientists under your authority.You have experience working with large time series data and creating analytics models with experience with other types of data (NLP, conversational AI, etc.) being a +. You’ll combine innovative skills in applied mathematics, stochastic and statistics, computer science, numerical mathematics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. You strive to be a conduit of honest and constructive feedback both up and down the chain. You are a flexible, proactive, self-starter with a positive attitude and always looking to push the boundaries of what is possible to create better user experiences.In this role you will:Develop accurate analytical models that integrate automotive data and expert domain knowledgeTranslating real-world business problems into an appropriate quantitative context and develop models that solve these questionsImplement, deploy, calibrate and backtest models and monitor resultsExplain model behavior and insights to strategic usersWrite production quality code to extend existing analytical functionalitySupport continual enhancement of methods and algorithms to ensure science is best-in-classEducate the organization and potential customers to manage expectations on achievable valueWork closely with a cross-functional team to define requirements and design features with the goal of securing continuous product market fit and growthBe a great communicator and be curious, willing to challenge yourself to learn new tools and improve your skillset whilst working with a wide spectrum of teams including Product, Innovation, Design, Brand, and Marketing.You should have:MS in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field, with a specialization in ML/AI10+ years of professional experience as data scientist, machine learning engineer, or related quantitative roleHands-on experience developing deep neural networks (RNN/LSTM and GRUs)Experience in statistical modeling with deep understanding of underlying mathematics, assumptions, and real-world interpretationsStrong coding skills in Python or equivalent high-level languageProven experience with pandas, numpy, sckit, tensorflow, or similar librariesKnowledge of ML frameworks such as Keras or PyTorchKnowledge of relational databases (SQL) and query authoringFamiliarity with Git and Docker a strong plusExperience writing production quality code and deploying models at scale in enterprise environmentsStrong communication skillsExperience in the mobility space, with electric vehicles and/or in battery science a plus, but not requiredUP.Labs Summary:We build high-growth technology startups that enable faster, cleaner, and safer movement of people and goods. Our vision is to transform the moving world by pairing leading corporations and entrepreneurs with a proven methodology for launching and scaling software and hardware companies.Our platform is unique in three ways:Risk: We reward our entire team and ecosystem of partners with meaningful equityTechnology: We build and launch scalable technology products that form the basis for each ventureIndustry Focus: We stay focused on the underlying fabric of society mobility and transportationWe work with corporate investors over a multi-year period to launch a portfolio of mobility-focused ventures. Our team is dedicated to the first year of a new venture’s life cycle: from ideation to minimum viable product build (and beyond) to recruiting and hiring the full-time team who will scale the business. We rapidly ideate concepts from scratch and vet them for early indicators of product-market fit.Our team:We are a group of entrepreneurs, investors, engineers, designers, who live, eat and breathe mobility. We have all launched early-stage companies and been part of their growth and scale. Our office is located in an airplane hangar at the Santa Monica Airport in Los Angeles, where we ideate, prototype, and take an occasional flight (or flying lesson).Opportunity Spaces:While we focus on mobility holistically, there are several opportunity spaces that we believe will have a particularly transformative impact on our world. Below are some of the spaces that excite us the most.SustainabilitySmart CitiesUrban Air MobilitySupply Chain ManagementAutomotive Software
